name: 80’s Trivia Card Game
discription:
The totally awesome trivia game!



Recall the 80’s with mixed tapes, retro 80’s style shades, and legit knowledge of the boss era You're tripping if you think this game isn't mad cool! Includes question cards and rules

name: Franklin® Spin N Putt Golf Game
discription:
Put a spin on your traditional putting!



Use your skill and luck to putt your balls into the different valued "holes" to score big If you miss the ball it will automatically roll back Reset the game by pressing the flag to play again Includes 10 hollow plastic balls and one kid sized (31" L) putter

name: Game On Catch Ball and Disc Set
discription:
Catching is easy with this set!



Includes 1 tennis-sized ball with loop outer surface and 2 plastic discs with hook surfaces & grips Builds hand-eye coordination and confidence Discs measure 7-1/8” in diameter with a 6-1/8” catch surface

name: Battleship® Game
discription:
The classic combat and strategy game!



Hunt down, launch, and destroy your opponent’s ships while hiding and protecting your own Each player’s fleet includes a sub, patrol boat, destroyer, aircraft carrier, and fierce battleship Includes 10 plastic ships, 84 red “hit” pegs, 168 white “miss” pegs, label sheet, and instructions Game comes packed in 2 portable battle cases

name: Giant Up 4 It Game
discription:
Great fun for players and spectators!



This bigger-than-life game measures 57" wide x 45" high and 17" deep Combines strategy, skill and of course a lot of luck! At almost 4 feet tall, this game will certainly make an impact

name: Fishing Game
discription:
Get hooked on this fun game!



This simple concept has been designed to allow for tons of activities and learning possibilities Can also be used to build math, spelling, and balance skills! Plastic fish have large round eyes where numbers or letters can be written using a dry erase marker See full details below for what is included

name: Outset Media® Cross Cribb Game
discription:
An exciting strategy game!



Played as a variation of cribbage and will appeal to both cribbage and non-cribbage players Build five high scoring cribbage hands while trying to sabotage your opponents’ hands Comes with rules for such variations as CrossCribb 20:20, CrossCribb Double Trouble and Cross Poker Includes 22" x 22" game board, a deck of cards, dice, pencil, instructions, and pad of score sheets

name: Retro TV Show Bingo™ Game
discription:
Perfect for sparking discussions!



Features beloved and familiar characters your residents will love to walk down memory lane with Includes 12 jumbo bingo boards featuring 9 assorted black & white “Retro TV Images” Deck of 52 calling cards that feature TV shows and names on one side, regular face card on other Bingo boards measures 9-1/2” x 13”; Calling cards measure 5” x 7-1/4”

name: Christmas Scavenger Hunt Game
discription:
Can YOU find everything?



Features hundreds of cards with everyday objects that can be found around the house at Christmas Deal several cards to each team and begin searching Makes a great activity for all ages

name: Jumbo Emoji Fitmatch Game Pack
discription:
Challenges players’ minds & bodies!



Includes our Jumbo Emoji Memory Cards and our popular fitness dice to create a fun and simple game Comes with 48 huge 8-1/2” x 11-3/4” cards with 24 different emoji graphics Spread the cards on any floor space and play the classic ‘flip the card over and make a match game’ 4” Fitness Dice have 6 exercises on one dice and number of repetitions to perform on the other

discription:

Bring back memories or create new ones with this throwback favorite Includes a 46-1/2" x 46-1/2" heavy-duty vinyl beanbag target, six 3-1/2" diameter beanbags Instructions included

Funky Bean Bag Toss Game Instructions


Contents

• Large Funky Beanbag Target
• Yellow Team Funky Beanbags
• Green Team Groovy Beanbags


Crafts for Multi-Surface Markers
With graphics inspired by the laid back times of the
60’s and 70’s, we don’t really think “the man”
should bring you down with rules! So you can play
anyway you want, just be cool and have fun. In case
you do want some suggestions, they are included
below.

Scoring Points:

A beanbag landing on the target scores points,
if and only if, the black dot on the beanbag is completely within
a numbered colored area on the target below. Once a beanbag
lands on a target, the points that the beanbag earns cannot be
changed by having another beanbag hit and move it.

Tossing Order:

In all games, players alternate throwing one of
their beanbags at the target. In the first game, the younger
player makes the first toss to start the game. In subsequent
games, the losing team would make the first toss. When both
players have thrown their 3 beanbags, it counts as a round. After a round, the player with the lower score starts the next round. If a beanbag lands in “Bummer (lose your turn)” a player does not throw a beanbag the next time it is their turn and would only throw 2
beanbags in a round.

Tossing Position:

We recommend putting a mark down on the floor about 4 feet from the target and requiring players to toss from
behind that line. The distance can be adjusted based on the ability of the players. For players of different abilities, the toss line
distance can be varied between the two players to try to give the lesser player an advantage.

Race to 60 Game:

The player to score a total of exactly 60 points wins the game! If a player lands on a number that would have
their total go over 60, then they subtract that number from their score! For example, if a player were at 50 points and their next
beanbag toss scores 25 points, then their new total would be 25 (50-25).

Race to 70 Game:

Same as above, players just need to score 70 points. Players can actually agree prior to the start of the game to
race to any number, we recommend 60 and 70 to stay in the theme of the game and to create quick games.

Double and Triple Score Race:
 Players pick a point total to race to, we recommend 225 as a starting point. In this game, if a player
scores two of a same point value during a round, they double the points for the matching values. If they score 3 of the same value
during a round, they triple the value of their points! Players still have to reach the desired point total exactly to win and if they go over, they still subtract the value of their last toss including double or triple score values.

5 to 25:

The first player to score at least one 5, 10, 15, 20 and 25 point toss, wins! Players are allowed to score more than one of any
point value, with no penalty.

Winner Takes All!

For this game players will use poker chips (like our GA2048) or coins (like pennies). Each player starts with an
equal number of chips or coins (try starting with 7 each the first time you play and adjust as you go). Players stand behind the starting line and toss a chip onto the target. Players score points for a chip or coin that lands completely within an area with a point total.
The player with the highest point value wins all the chips. If two or more players score the same point total, those players throw
another chip until one player wins. The winning player wins all the chips tossed since the end of the previous round including all
those that did not stay on the mat. For a faster game, players can spread out an equal distance from the target and all toss at once, just make sure you know who tossed which chip or coin! Once a player runs out of chips, they are out of the game. Play continues until
one player wins all the chips.

This wooden Cornhole set is built using all wood materials to provide the ultimate Cornhole experience. The games are handcrafted from 100% wood as they do not include any composite materials or plastics. The 4’ x 2’ size is made to ACA regulations. The top surface is 1/2” varnished cabinet-grade plywood (ACA regulation), which provides the perfect amount of slide. Both sizes are made using handcrafted pine wood frames, featuring mitered corner joints. The wooden legs are retractable and are held in place by robust 3/8” galvanized steel bolts with wing nuts. Also included are 8 regulation size all-weather CornHole Bags which measure 6” x 6” and weigh 1 pound each. These bags are filled with recycled plastic pellets, but unlike corn, they will not rot if they get wet. Overall this is a well-built Cornhole set for Cornhole enthusiast. Portable set weighs about 38 pounds.

Combines tossing skill and classic card game play! Pick your target, toss your beanbags onto the jumbo target mat and go for the straight flush! The game features a huge 48" x 60" heavy-duty target mat, ten 3-1/2"-diameter beanbags with 5 each in yellow and green, and instructions for fun games including poker, black jack - even a pitching pennies game. For 2 or more players, ages 5 and up. Beanbags weigh about 30 grams each.
